div.p: School didn’t suit me at all so not really, I wouldn’t say I took very much from school really; I took all I could. It’s more after school where it sort of
really kicked in "right I need to sort my life out I need to do something" so I went and did a course which gave me a Level 1 in Business Administration
which was a good foundation for what I went on to do next which was an apprenticeship for a recruitment agency so it was still a lot of
front of house so from quite a young age I built up quite a lot of experience meeting new people which I manage to put to use now
and build up to Level 2 in Business Admin and then I finished that and then took a while off because I had my little girl and then
decided I wanted to go back to work again so I went onto an Inspire project which is sort of like gaining more work experience in a work environment
and learnt all I could from that and listened to people and just really tried to throw myself into it. What I enjoyed the most was just not being
in that school classroom environment I think, not having someone stood at the front of the class telling you things and having to think
“oh gosh I don't remember any of that” there’s someone there and in a work environment you learn what you need to know to be able to
do your job so I think I enjoy just not having to worry about doing Maths lessons or English lessons it was more sort of
"right you need to know this to be able to do your job" and just learning that and then you know having a manager there to oversee things
not just to tell you what you’re doing but to go to and say “look, sorry, I don’t understand this can you go through it again?”
and just sort of working through it.
To be honest I enjoyed college but I think while I was at college I wasn’t specifically doing a course I was there in my last year of school
because I didn’t get kicked out of school but I had troubles at school so they thought it would be a more suitable place for me doing pre-16
so I enjoyed it but I wasn't in the right frame of mind for it while I was there it was more after that I went on to do more training in admin
when I sorted myself out mentally a bit I think that I actually enjoyed and got something out of it.
